Seroflow

  • View page source

Utils

The utils.py module provides a set of utility functions for various common operations. These include generating hash keys, retrieving and hashing function source code, dictionary filtering, AST node conversion, extracting function return elements, file gathering, file/directory checks and creation, and string manipulation functions.

Overview

The module contains functions for:

  • Hashing & Source Code Operations: Generate unique keys from strings, retrieve function source code, and compute source code hashes.

  • Dictionary Utilities: Check for keyword presence in dictionaries and filter out specified keys.

  • AST & Return Value Extraction: Convert AST nodes to Python objects and extract return elements from function source code.

  • File Gathering & File System Operations: Collect files based on file extensions, check for the existence of directories/files, create directories/files, and perform basic file path manipulations.

utils

Module: utils.py

This module provides utility functions for various common operations such as:

  • Generating hash keys from strings.

  • Retrieving and hashing function source code.

  • Checking for keyword presence in dictionaries.

  • Filtering dictionaries.

  • Converting AST nodes to Python objects.

  • Extracting return elements from function source code.

  • Gathering files from a directory based on file extensions.

  • Checking and creating files and directories.

  • Splitting strings by the last delimiter and removing file extensions.

seroflow.utils.utils.check_directory(path)

Verify that the given path is a directory.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to verify.

Returns:

True if the path is a directory, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

seroflow.utils.utils.check_file(path)

Verify that the given path is a file.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to verify.

Returns:

True if the path is a file, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

seroflow.utils.utils.check_kw_in_kwargs(kw, kwargs)

Check if a given keyword exists in the provided kwargs dictionary.

Parameters:

  • kw (str) – The keyword to search for.

  • kwargs (dict) – The dictionary of keyword arguments.

Returns:

True if the keyword is present, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

seroflow.utils.utils.check_str_is_file(path)

Verify that the given path is a file and not directory.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to verify.

Returns:

False if the path is a directory, True otherwise.

Return type:

bool

seroflow.utils.utils.create_directory(path)

Create a directory at the specified path if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

path (str) – The directory path to create.

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during directory creation.

seroflow.utils.utils.create_file(path)

Create an empty file at the specified path if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

path (str) – The file path to create.

Raises:

Exception – If an error occurs during file creation.

seroflow.utils.utils.filter_kwargs(kwargs, keys_to_remove)

Filter out specified keys from a dictionary of keyword arguments.

Parameters:

  • kwargs (dict) – The original dictionary of keyword arguments.

  • keys_to_remove (iterable) – An iterable of keys to be removed from kwargs.

Returns:

A new dictionary with the specified keys removed.

Return type:

dict

seroflow.utils.utils.find_dir(path)

Check if the specified path is a directory.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to check.

Returns:

True if the path is a directory, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

seroflow.utils.utils.find_file(path)

Check if the specified path is a file.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to check.

Returns:

True if the path is a file, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

seroflow.utils.utils.gather_files(source, file_type)

Gather files from a specified directory that match the given file extensions.

Parameters:

  • source (str) – The directory path to search for files.

  • file_type (iterable) – An iterable of file extension strings

  • (e.g.

  • ['.csv'

  • match. ('.txt']) to)

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • file_paths (list): A list of full file paths for the matching files.

  • file_names (list): A list of file names for the matching files.

Return type:

tuple

seroflow.utils.utils.generate_key(input_string)

Generate a unique MD5 hash key from the given input string.

Parameters:

input_string (str) – The input string to hash.

Returns:

The MD5 hash of the input string in hexadecimal format.

Return type:

str

seroflow.utils.utils.get_function_hash(func)

Retrieve the source code of a function and compute its SHA-256 hash.

Parameters:

func (function) – The function for which to compute the hash.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • source_code (str): The source code of the function.

  • code_hash (str): The SHA-256 hash of the source code.

Return type:

tuple

seroflow.utils.utils.get_function_source(func)

Retrieve the source code of the given function.

Parameters:

func (function) – The function whose source code is to be retrieved.

Returns:

The source code of the function.

Return type:

str

seroflow.utils.utils.get_return_elements(func)

Extract and return the elements of the return statement from a function’s source code.

This function uses AST parsing to inspect the function definition and extract the values returned by the function. If the return value is a tuple, each element is converted using _convert_ast_node_to_python.

Parameters:

func (function) – The function from which to extract return elements.

Returns:

A list of elements extracted from the return statement. Returns an empty list

if no return statement or elements are found.

Return type:

list

seroflow.utils.utils.hash_source(source)

Generate a SHA-256 hash for the given source string.

Parameters:

source (str) – The source code string to hash.

Returns:

The SHA-256 hash of the source in hexadecimal format.

Return type:

str

seroflow.utils.utils.remove_extension(filename)

Remove the file extension from a filename.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The filename from which to remove the extension.

Returns:

The filename without its extension.

Return type:

str

seroflow.utils.utils.split_last_delimiter(value, delimiter='.')

Split a string by the last occurrence of the specified delimiter.

Parameters:

  • value (str) – The string to split.

  • delimiter (str, optional) – The delimiter on which to split the string. Defaults to ‘.’.

Returns:

A list of substrings resulting from the split.

Typically, this will be a list with two elements, where the first element is the part of the string before the last delimiter.

Return type:

list
